Name: Social Services Sites, Licensing Review
Title: A Local Law to amend the Administrative Code of the City of New York, in relation to reviewing sites obtained through licensing agreements for the Department of Social Services.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section one.  Chapter one of title twenty-one of the administrative code of the city of New York is hereby amended by adding a new section 21-123, to read as follows:
	�21-123 Licensing Agreements.  a) The commissioner, not less than thirty days prior to signing a licensing agreement to utilize a site obtained by the city through a month to month licensing or other short-term agreement, for the purpose of providing agency boarding homes, shall:
	1)	give verbal notification to the affected borough president, council member and community board prior to the signing of a license agreement for a site;
	2)	offer, in writing, to meet with the community board to discuss the program generally and the specific plans for each site; and
	3)	provide public notice to the affected community of any scheduled public hearings regarding the site.
		b)	Within seven calendar days after the signing of a licensing agreement, the commissioner shall:
	1)	send written confirmation of the planned program and the projected opening date to the affected borough president, council member and community board; 
	2)	designate, in writing, the age group to be housed at the site.  The age group designation shall be one of the following:
		i.	zero to five years; or
		ii.	six to ten years; or
		iii.	eleven to twenty-one years.
	3)	coordinate the creation of a community advisory committee to act in an advisory capacity to the agency boarding home and to monitor the operations of the home; and
	4)	select an opening date not less than sixty days from the signing of a licensing agreement unless the community board recommends the site.  If the site is recommended, the agency boarding home may open immediately.
	c.	The age group housed at each specific site shall not be changed without providing sixty days written notice to, and an offer to meet with, the affected borough president, council member and community board.  Such notice shall include details of the proposed change including, but not limited to, changes in supervision and services; 
	d)	The commissioner shall not renew the licensing agreement unless the department of social services (i) within thirty days of the opening of an agency boarding home pursuant to a licensing agreement complies with the requirements of '197-c (b) of the charter of the city of New York for the lease and operation of the agency boarding home; and (ii) has the application certified by the department of city planning within six months of the date of the original licensing agreement.
	�2.	This local law shall take effect 30 days after it shall have been enacted into law.
